events.title: Mobilize | Art Inspiring Activism with Wild & Scenic Film Festival Exhibition
events.description: Mobilize is the first exhibition of 2026 under Art in Public Spaces and celebrates a 15-year partnership between Nevada County Arts Council and Wild & Scenic Film Festival. This year’s festival theme and title of the Rood Center exhibition, MOBILIZE, serves as a call to action and a celebration of progress toward tangible change. The exhibition explores Wild and Scenic’s rich history and its visual art exhibition, utilizing visual language to elevate voices, organize efforts, and address environmental challenges.

events.title: Custom Hat Making
events.description: Step into the timeless craft of millinery in this immersive two-day Custom Hat Making workshop. From your first block to the final stitch, you’ll transform high-quality rabbit felt into a beautifully finished, wearable hat that reflects your personal style. events.title: Woodturning 101 – Craft a Beautiful Wooden Bowl
events.description: Discover the art of woodturning and learn to make a beautiful wood bowl using a wood lathe – no experience is required!, Are you interested in woodturning and looking to learn a new skill? In this class, you’ll learn how to turn a beautiful bowl out of wood using a lathe. The process is both rewarding and relaxing, as you take a piece of raw wood and turn it into a functional work of wood art. Under the guidance of our experienced instructor, you’ll start by learning the basics of wood lathe operation and safety. Once you’re comfortable with the equipment, we’ll move on to selecting and preparing the wood for turning. With the wood secured on the lathe, you’ll use a series of specially designed tools to shape the bowl. , At the end of the class, you’ll take home a beautiful, hand-turned bowl that you can be proud of. You’ll also have the woodturning skills and knowledge to continue turning bowls on your own. , Price: $160 + $40 materials, Limited spaces available. Sign up today! Class 2 minimum/3 maximum participants – (please note: if attendance does not meet minimum, class will be rescheduled) , Tools provided. If you have tools, please feel free to bring them.

events.description: Fun for the whole family -- Parade: Lion Dancers, Dragons, Mulan, school children, and theatre groups. Festival: Asian food, sword fight demonstration, hula, mahjong, kids' table, children's book launch, film documentary on local Chinese families, and more awaits!

events.title: Nevada City Chinese Lunar New Year Parade and Festival
events.venue_name: Commercial Street in Nevada City and at the Miners Foundry.
events.description: The community parade begins at 12:00 noon from the bottom of the Chinese Quarter on Commercial Street (Robinson Plaza) in Nevada City, where revelers may line up. After the Lion Dancing outdoor performance on Spring Street, more entertainment, exhibits, and fun will take place inside the Miners Foundry beginning at 1:00 p.m. Free admission. We thank the Miners Foundry, the Nevada City Chamber of Commerce, the City of Nevada City, and the Nevada City Arts Council for their collaboration., Our parade Grand Marshals are Susan Levitz and Pascale Fusshoeller, founders of YubaNet.com, who have been staunch supporters of CATS and a great asset and news source to the community. , Parade units include the audience favorite -- Chinese ceremonial Lion Dancers and a 72’ Chinese Dragon from Eastern Ways Martial Arts of Sacramento -- second and third graders from Bell Hill Academy, “Mulan,” (aka Lily Emmolo), members of Grass Valley Aikikai martial arts, theatre groups, and other community entries. Food vendors at the Miners Foundry are Kaliko’s Hawaiian Kitchen and Gold Rush Cookies. There will be Asian-themed arts and crafts and gifts for sale, a kid’s table, mahjong, a new children’s Chinese New Year book launch and sale by Allison Chan, face painting with Chinese horoscope tattoos, Chinese tea ceremony demonstrations, Rose Murphy from the Nevada County Historical Society promoting free self-guided historic walking tours of the Grass Valley and Nevada City Chinatowns, Lisa Redfern and Rose Murphy showing their film, "Chinese Family Stories - From Exclusion to Pillars of the Community," community vendors and more. We are seeking parade entries, entertainers, vendors, exhibitors, sponsors, and lots of volunteers. Contact Jeannie Wood at info@catsweb.org

Whether you’re brand new to ceramics or looking to expand your skills, this class with instructor Bob Davis is designed to give you a well-rounded understanding of this dynamic medium., You’ll explore a variety of techniques, including:, Potter’s Wheel – Learn the fundamentals of throwing and shaping clay., Hand-Building – Create unique forms using slabs, coils, and extruders., Surface Design & Embellishment – Experiment with textures, patterns, and finishing techniques., Throughout the course, you’ll craft a variety of functional and decorative pieces—choose from sushi plates, tapas servers, cups, spoon rests, succulent planters, and more! By the end of the series, you’ll gain confidence in your skills and discover which techniques inspire you most., No experience? No problem! This class is open to all levels, from total beginners to those looking to refine their craft., Ages: 15 – Adult, Price: $162 + $30 materials, Total Class Time: Three 3-hour Classes = 9 hours, Note: Your Glazed pieces will be ready for pick up 7-10 days after they have been fired, or you can opt for the convenience of having your masterpiece shipped to you for a small shipping and handling fee., Join us for a hands-on creative journey and take home your own handmade ceramics!, All supplies provided, Class 4 minimum/8 maximum participants – (please note: if attendance does not meet minimum, class will be rescheduled)

events.title: Ray Ushikubo: Piano and Violin Virtuoso
events.description: Ray showcases his stunning and award winning musicianship on both piano and violin. Ray will play the MIM Steinway Grand as well as one of the rarest and most famous violins in the world, the 1741 "Playfair" Guarneri del Gesù violin. At the age of only 24, he has already performed as a soloist with major orchestras across the United States, including as a pianist with the Los Angeles Philharmonic, as a violin soloist with the Los Angeles Chamber Orchestra, and on the Tonight Show with Jay Leno!

events.title: Glassblowing for Beginners – Make a Paperweight
events.description: Glassblowing for Beginners Level 1 – An introduction to Glassblowing, Experience the enchanting art of glassblowing and transform molten glass into a stunning physical creation in just 3 hours! This beginner-friendly class is designed to introduce you to the fundamentals of glassblowing and let you unleash your creativity., Starting with a brief safety and tool identification talk, we’ll quickly move on to the exciting part – working with hot glass! You’ll have the opportunity to gather glass, manipulate it with fire and tools, and shape it into a beautiful work of art. Under the guidance of our experienced glassblower, you’ll create a one-of-a-kind colored glass paperweight that you can proudly display in your home or office. This hands-on class will allow you to experience the magic of glassblowing while learning a new skill that you can continue to develop. Don’t miss out on this unique opportunity to explore the ancient art of glassblowing and create a beautiful piece of art to take home!, Your stunning glass creations will be ready for pickup at The Forge within a few days of your class, or you can opt for the convenience of having your masterpiece shipped to you for a small shipping and handling fee., Disclaimer: Occasionally, hot glass may break during the annealing process. If your glass piece breaks, you will have the option to select a similar replacement piece from our stock of handblown glass items., Ages 14+, Price: $180, Class minimum 2 students/maximum 4 students. If the class minimum is not met, the class will be rescheduled to a later date.

events.title: The Rocket Man
events.description: Presented by The Center for the Arts , Tuesday, March 3, 2026, Doors: 6pm | Show: 7pm, The Center for the Arts | 314 W. Main Street, Grass Valley, CA, Tickets: Reserved Seating , , Genre: Tribute, Attention Elton John fans! Moon Coin Productions (Producers of ABBA Tribute “ABRA Cadabra” and Eagles Tribute “Take It To The Limit”) Presents The Rocket Man – A Tribute to Elton John from Vancouver performing in Grass Valley for the 1st time on March 3, 2026., Don't miss this usually and musically captivating stage production led by accomplished Vocalist, Pianist and Star Performer Sean Trombley who gives a genuine & powerful Tribute to the music that inspired him as a vocalist and musician. Sean’s stunning vocals capture the essence of Elton John at the height of his vocal power and range in the 1970’s and he brings these beautiful songs to life in a way that touches the soul and uplifts the heart. Backed by a spectacular live band, multi-media, dazzling costumes and captivating dancers, this high-energy cast of performers will transport you back in time and have you moving, smiling and singing along to all of Elton John’s most iconic hits including Rocket Man, Crocodile Rock, Benny & The Jets, Tiny Dancer, Your Song, Saturday Night’s Alright, Philadelphia Freedom, Good-bye Yellow brick Road, Daniel, Candle In The Wind and countless others! A must see show if you love the music of Elton John!

events.title: Opera 101: Musings with the Maestro
events.description: This conversation with Ryan Murray invites ​you to ​reconsider how you think about opera, whether you are a devoted fan, have never experienced it, or are… opera-curious. In this lively, interactive Zoom presentation, the Maestro​ (MIM Artistic Director Ryan Murray) pulls back the curtain on one of the most dynamic and emotionally powerful art forms ever created. Tracing opera’s evolution from the 1600s to today, participants will explore how opera has continually reinvented itself across centuries, styles, and cultures., Far from being elitist, opera was originally the people’s art—an immersive blend of orchestra, voice, drama, design, and storytelling. Through highlights of essential works, engaging commentary, and audience Q&A, attendees will gain practical tools to explore opera on their own and discover what resonates with them. No prior musical experience is required—just curiosity. Whether you’re brand new to opera or simply want a fresh perspective, this welcoming, plain language session offers an ideal access point into a vast and thrilling corner of the classical repertoire., Ryan Murray is the Artistic Director of Music in the Mountains, Music Director of the Auburn Symphony, Principal Pops Conductor of the Modesto Symphony and he is the Director of Orchestra and Opera at California State University Sacramento, and conducts the Sacramento Youth Symphony. An award-winning opera conductor, Ryan is the past Music Director of Opera Modesto and Fresno Grand Opera., , Ryan was the winner of the Vienna Philharmonic’s prestigious Ansbacher Fellowship for Young Conductors and was awarded second place in the 2019 American Prize for Orchestral Conducting; he garnered national recognition for his performances of contemporary opera as the winner of the 2017 American Prize in Opera.

events.title: Oil & Acrylic Painting: A Guided Exploration with Chappy
events.description: Oil & Acrylic Adventures: Your Subject, Your Style. In-depth personalized painting instruction on the subject matter of your choice., Class Details:, Schedule: Four 3-hour sessions (12 hours total), Cost: $198 for the public, Level: Suitable for beginners and experienced painters, Class Overview, Explore the art of painting in this fun and immersive four-session workshop! Using a simple and effective four-step approach, you’ll learn how to bring any subject to life—whether it’s a portrait, a wildflower-filled landscape, or a captivating still life. Over four weeks, you’ll gain a broader understanding of composition, color, value, and texture, ending the series with a completed painting you’re proud of. Guided by Chappy, you’ll receive personalized instruction tailored to your creative vision., What You’ll Learn:, A straightforward four-step painting process, Principles of composition, color, value, and texture, How to translate your chosen subject into a successful painting, What to Bring:, Any opaque medium and matching brushes (Don’t buy any new paints until after you attend the first class and Chappy will review supplies with you), Two painting surfaces (canvas, paper, board, etc.), Several photos of your subject (5×7 or larger hard copy recommended or an iPad), A painting smock or old clothes, If you do not have any painting supplies yet, please contact spark@thecuriousforge.org for a list of supplies needed to start., Additional Information:, Class Size: Minimum 4, Maximum 6 participants, Registration: Pre-registration required, Cancellation Policy: 7-day advance notification required (read the full policy here), Get ready to unleash your creativity and paint whatever the heck you want!

events.title: Intro to Stained Glass – Level 1
events.description: Intro to Stained Glass. Level 1 – Straight Cuts, Experience the art of stained glass in this beginner-friendly workshop! Join us to craft a small suncatcher using vibrant glass pieces in this class with Charne Morris. No experience necessary—just bring your enthusiasm!, This introductory class focuses on straight cuts and will teach you the basics of stained glass safety., Throughout this 3-hour class, you will learn pattern transfer, glass cutting, grinding, foiling, soldering, and polishing. You will go home with a finished project piece that is roughly 3.5” x 4”., A materials cost of $20 is required on the day. Payment to the facilitator can be made using cash or Venmo., What You’ll Learn:, Basics of stained glass art, How glass behaves and the creation process, Selecting and cutting glass pieces, Creating a stained glass suncatcher using the copper foil method and soldering techniques, Details:, Duration: 3 hours, Price: $79 class fee + plus additional material fee $20 is required during class. Payment to the facilitator can be made using cash or Venmo., Ages: Adults and 16+, Participants: Minimum of 3, maximum of 6 (Class will be rescheduled if minimum attendance is not met) Please note: All classes require a minimum number of participants and may be rescheduled if that minimum is not met. If this happens, we’ll let you know in advance and work with you to get you into the next available class., Join us for this creative journey and leave with your own stunning stained glass suncatcher!

events.title: Opening Talk with Artist and Writer Jonathon Keats
events.description: Traverse the expanse of time and consider the environmental complexities that led to the concept and creation of Centuries of the Bristlecone with Jonathon Keats, artist, writer, and experimental philosopher. Keats’ conceptually driven transdisciplinary projects explore all aspects of society, adapting methods from the sciences and the humanities. Following the talk, enjoy a ceremonial etching on the clock., , Centuries of the Bristlecone is now on-view and was created in collaboration with Phil Abernethy, Brittany Cox, Jason Iceman, and The Long Now Foundation., , This public talk is a complementary program to the 2026 NV STEAM Conference.

events.title: Advanced Glassblowing Level 4 – Discovering New Techniques

Work with Robert and learn advanced glassblowing techniques. You will also learn basic teamwork skills necessary to move forward to the next level of glassblowing classes., Learn how to use frit and powders to achieve patterns other then the spotted look we are familiar with. Create the look of feathers, scales, stone, cracked earth and other effects. Your instructor will spend the first hour and a half demonstrating them and students will be let loose to try some for themselves., Your stunning glass creations will be ready for pickup at The Forge within a few days of your class, or you can opt for the convenience of having your masterpiece shipped to you for a small shipping and handling fee.Ages 16+ and Adults, Class minimum 2 students/maximum 4 students. events.description: St. Piran's Day Pasty Toss is a fun, family-friendly tradition we have here in Grass Valley honoring our Cornish connection. Pasties made for tossing are prepared with pet-friendly ingredients, so bring your dog and let them join in the fun!

events.title: ST PIRAN'S DAY Celebration in Downtown Grass Valley! Join us as Grass Valley honors its rich Cornish heritage with a lively Saint Piran’s Day celebration.
events.description: 🎉 Celebrate Saint Piran’s Day in Grass Valley! 🎉, Join us as Grass Valley honors its rich Cornish heritage with a lively Saint Piran’s Day celebration. From flag-raising and Cornish songs to the legendary Pasty Toss, this family-friendly event pays tribute to the Cornish miners who helped shape our town. Come enjoy tradition, community, and a taste of history—because on Saint Piran’s Day, everyone’s Cornish! 🖤🤍🥟

events.title: Glassblowing for Beginners – Make a Paperweight
events.description: Glassblowing for Beginners Level 1 – An introduction to Glassblowing, Experience the enchanting art of glassblowing and transform molten glass into a stunning physical creation in just 3 hours! This beginner-friendly class is designed to introduce you to the fundamentals of glassblowing and let you unleash your creativity., Starting with a brief safety and tool identification talk, we’ll quickly move on to the exciting part – working with hot glass! You’ll have the opportunity to gather glass, manipulate it with fire and tools, and shape it into a beautiful work of art. Under the guidance of our experienced glassblower, you’ll create a one-of-a-kind colored glass paperweight that you can proudly display in your home or office. This hands-on class will allow you to experience the magic of glassblowing while learning a new skill that you can continue to develop. Don’t miss out on this unique opportunity to explore the ancient art of glassblowing and create a beautiful piece of art to take home!, Your stunning glass creations will be ready for pickup at The Forge within a few days of your class, or you can opt for the convenience of having your masterpiece shipped to you for a small shipping and handling fee., Disclaimer: Occasionally, hot glass may break during the annealing process. If your glass piece breaks, you will have the option to select a similar replacement piece from our stock of handblown glass items., Ages 14+, Price: $180, Class minimum 2 students/maximum 4 students. If the class minimum is not met, the class will be rescheduled to a later date.

This class is taught by Grace Kendrick, E-RYT, CAS. More about Grace: Grace is an experienced Registered Yoga Teacher (e-RYT) and Certified Ayurveda Specialist (C.A.S.) holding yoga certifications through the White Lotus Foundat
events.venue_address: Main Reading Room, Madelyn Helling Library

events.title: Kid’s Creation Day! Silly Sculptures & Fun Figures in Polymer Clay
events.description: Kids’ Creation Day! Fun with Polymer Clay, Join us for a colorful, hands-on adventure in sculpting, shaping, and imagining! Polymer clay is the perfect, no-mess medium for kids of all ages to explore their creativity. In this fun and flexible workshop, young makers will experiment with different texturing tools, colors, and techniques to bring their ideas to life — from silly creatures and tiny treasures to action figurines and imaginative keepsakes., We’ll bake each creation during class so everyone goes home with a finished, cured piece they can proudly display. If time allows, we’ll even add a splash of color with paints for extra flair!, Our youth workshops are designed to be both playful and educational, guided by experienced instructors who love helping kids discover the joy of making. Every class is a new opportunity for your child to explore, experiment, and create something totally unique., Ages: 6-16 (no experience needed), Schedule: Offered once a month — 1-day workshop (1–2 hours), Cost: $30 + $15 materials fee, Class Size: Minimum 3 / Maximum 8 participants, Let your child’s imagination run wild — the sky’s the limit!

events.title: Flameworking Implosion Marbles
events.description: Flameworking Implosion Marbles –, Prerequisite: prior flameworking class or experience, Discover the magic hidden inside molten glass., In this flameworking series, participants will dive into the mesmerizing world of implosion marbles—where heat, gravity, and precision come together to create intricate 3D designs suspended inside solid glass. Working on the torch, you’ll learn how to carefully control molten glass as surface designs are drawn inward, forming layered, dimensional patterns within a perfectly shaped marble., Across three hands-on sessions, you’ll explore multiple implosion styles while refining your heat control, shaping skills, and surface decoration techniques. This class is both technical and awe-inspiring, offering plenty of “how did that just happen?” moments as glass seemingly moves on its own., What You’ll Create, Solid glass marbles, Frit implosion marbles, Firework implosion marbles, Flower implosion marbles, What You’ll Learn, Advanced heat control on the torch, Imploding solid glass to create 3D internal designs, Shaping and finishing marbles, Drawing and layering color on the glass surface, How to harness the magic of glass movement, Class Details, Skill Level: prior flameworking class or experience required, Format: 3-session series | 3 hours per session, Dates: Saturdays — 3/7, 3/14, and 3/21, Time: 1:00–4:00 PM, Ages: Adults & Teens 12+, Class Size: Maximum of 6 participants, Price: $225 + $60 materials fee, Additional Notes, Please wear natural fiber clothing (cotton, wool, etc.), Bring a snack and water for break time, Whether you’re fascinated by technical glasswork or drawn to the visual drama of implosions, this class offers a deep dive into one of flameworking’s most captivating techniques—leaving you with beautiful, mind-bending marbles and sharpened torch skills to match.

Please reserve your space with a ticket below., Cost: $65 per person, Adults and Teens age 14+, Your stunning glass creations will be ready for pickup at The Forge within a few days of your class, or you can opt for the convenience of having your masterpiece shipped to you for a small shipping and handling fee.

events.title: Grand Illusion (La grande illusion)
events.description: In 1917, in a German camp, a group of French prisoners - including Captain de Boëldieu (Pierre Fresnay) and Lieutenants Maréchal (Jean Gabin) and Rosenthal (Marcel Dalio) - prepare to escape. At the last moment, they are moved to a fortress commanded by German aristocrat von Rauffenstein (Eric von Stroheim), who becomes friendly with Boëldieu. One of the very first prison escape movies, GRAND ILLUSION is considered Jean Renoir’s antiwar masterpiece, and one of the greatest films ever made. IN FRENCH W/ ENGLISH SUBTITLES

Whether playwriting is new to you or you're already an accomplished playwright, come join this on-going bi-weekly writers' group. We'll spend our time focusing on our writing, but with that magical element of doing so within the presence of others. Come discover the amazing experience of writing within the context of a group. Bring your computer, notebook, iPad, or whatever you like to use for writing. We share resources, discuss our goals and challenges, even provide feedback, but the primary focus of the group is to work on your own play! We'll do a check-in/discussion at the beginning of the meeting, then write in silence, and check-out at the end of our session. Contact Kimberly for the location and to answer any questions you may have.

events.title: Stay and Play
events.description: Stay and Play is a play group and storytime for kids age 0-5 and their adults. We especially invite nontraditional caregivers (friends, family members, and neighbors) who care for children in an informal way. Each week features open play for the first hour with fun and creative early literacy toys, followed by a storytime at 11am. Snacks for kids and coffee/tea for adults is available throughout. Stay and Play is outdoors in the back yard of the Grass Valley Library except on days when it is 40°

events.title: Qigong
events.description: Use breathing techniques, gentle movement, and meditation to cleanse, strengthen, and circulate your life energy (qi), Qigong promotes health and vitality and a tranquil state that we call a “Qigong state of mind.” These sessions provide a practical, easy-to-follow, daily ritual to self-healing, presented by Connecting Point & Nevada County Library.

events.title: Preschool Music Time with Justin!
events.description: Join us for stories, songs and rhymes. It is a great way to build early literacy, creativity and social skills. Únete a nosotros para cuentos, cantos y rimas. Es una manera buena para desarrollar alfabetización temprana, creatividad, y habilidades sociales.

events.title: Intermediate/Advanced English Conversation Group
events.description: This is a weekly conversation group for intermediate to advanced level English language learners to learn, improve and practice their English-speaking skills. Conversation practice will be emphasized. No registration required. ¿Necesita mejorar su comunicación en inglés? ¡Únase a nosotros al clase del inglés y practique con plática y más! No necesita inscribirse.

events.title: Paws to Read with Scout
events.description: Come read to Scout, a certified therapy dog, who loves a pet and a story.

Ages 8 & up. Children under 13 must be accompanied by parent or guardian. events.description: During this bi-monthly book club, we'll discuss a book, enjoy some snacks, and have fun with a themed craft. This book club is best suited for patrons ages 8-12. Registration is required for all attendees who would like an honor copy of the book. Register after February 1 and drop by Madelyn Helling Library to pick up a copy of the book--no check out required! Copies are limited to the first 10 registrants. events.description: It’s Karaoke Night at GVBC with DJ Kenn! You know what that means; bring your song choices, your voice and your friends. We’ve got the DJ, the tunes and the beer. It’s going to be a great time, come on down and sing your heart out! All ages welcome.

events.description: Open Mic hosted by Nevada County Poet Laureate Karen Terrey, open mic readers compete for a chance to read their work from the Main Stage at the 10th annual Sierra Poetry Festival on Saturday, April 18. Two winners will be selected by a panel of judges.
